content:
Should this warning be where it is now or at the top of the page (where "Notifications are triggered" is )

Screen-Shot-2018-08-19-at-3.15.17-PM.png

If we put a warning like this, it should go at the top. The current warning should not really be a warning, and should just be regular text.

But I think we can just grey out the mobile options in this case, instead of having a warning? And maybe on hover have a title text of "Server not configured for mobile notifications."?
We could also do something like on-hover replace the text of the setting itself with that warning.
@Rishi Gupta note that we need to have a link to the instructions for setting up mobile push notifications on the server.
So a design that supports that model is important here.
(Also, the current thing we have is I think our "tip" styling, not "warning" styling, and I think it's right to put it in a box. Though maybe the color choice is a bit weird in night mode)

I like the idea of just having the "Mobile notifications" lines become
"[ ] Mobile notifications not available on this server. " with the checkbox disabled, and the "on this server" part being a link to the signup process doc, with no fancy hover behavior or anything.
hm, I do like showing the original setting, though the design of this page is changing anyway so maybe just worth doing something simple now.
